greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of number of zeros when n is written in base k (2 <= k <= n).
formula: T(nk, k)=T(n, k)+1; T(nk+m, k)=T(n, k) if 0<m<k; T(k, k)=1; T(n, k)=0 if n/2<k<n or 0<n<k.
example: 9 can be written in bases 2-9 as: 1001, 100, 21, 14, 13, 12, 11 and 10, in which case the numbers of zeros are 2,2,0,0,0,0,0,1.
program: tabl(nn) = for (n=2, nn, print(row(n))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 02 2020
xref: Columns include A023416 and A077267. Row sums are A033093, row maxima are A062842, number of positive terms in each row are A077268.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Nov 01 2002
